abstract.para: To change kernel boot parameters persistently for all subsequent boot processes, edit the kernel parameters using &yastcc;.

section.title: Introduction
section.para: Permanent or persistent changes are helpful if a change needs to be applied for all subsequent boot processes. Your changes are applied to all subsequent boot processes, unless modified further.

section.title: Requirements
section.para: To change kernel boot parameters for all subsequent boot processes, you should have root or equivalent administrative privileges.

section.title: Permanently modify kernel boot parameters using &yastcc;
section.para: As an example of modifying kernel boot parameters persistently for all subsequent boot process, we disable the splash screen that you can see during the boot.

tip.para: Before modifying kernel boot parameters, create a copy of the existing stable configuration somewhere outside of your system. If the boat loader gets corrupted and your system fails to boot, or you face problems after booting your system, the back up helps you compare and restore the parameters to the last known working configuration.

step.para: Log in to your system as root, or switch to a user with equivalent administrative priviliges after logging in to your system.
In your running system, open a root shell and run the following command:
Alternatively, open the &yastcc; application and navigate to System > Boot Loader.
Under the Kernel Parameters tab, edit the string for the Optional Kernel Command Line Parameter field.
As you can see, the string splash=silent is printed. Remove splash=silent from the string.
Select OK to save the boot loader configuration.
Reboot. You should see that the splash screen does not appear.

section.title: Summary
section.para: After executing the procedure and rebooting the system, you will not observe any splash screen for all subsequent boot process unless the kernel parameter configurartion is modified again.
